sub_title: Sr. Manager Procurement Benelux sites at SABIC
summary:
About SABIC

SABIC is the Saudi Basic Industries Corporation, one of the world’s leading manufacturers of chemicals, fertilizers, plastics and metals.
 
The SABIC corporate culture is characterized by its ability to adapt quickly to our customer needs and requirements. From the Company’s start in 1976 to the present day, our tradition of ingenuity has driven continuous improvement in the way we operate and a relentless drive for growth. As a global company with around 40,000 employees taken from many different countries and backgrounds, our business meets the needs of customers in over 100 countries. Every day, our products touch the lives of millions of people all around the world. From chemicals, innovative plastics, and polymers to fertilizers and metals - SABIC products are fundamental to improving our quality of life

Our aim is to become the world’s preferred manufacturer and marketer of chemical and metal products. We are ambitious and competitive, and we will achieve our aim by supplying high-quality industrial products and services to our customers, and by satisfying the expectations of our shareholders.

SABIC procurement is buying the direct and indirect materials for all SBU's and affiliates under the SABIC Group. We are with a community of 1000+ Sourcing, purchasing, warehousing and logistics professionals.

projects.title: SABIC FANAR+ Global Project
projects.description: FANAR+ is the largest IT Program that SABIC has ever run. It will standardize the company’s processes and enable SABIC to operate as one single global business in its markets, improving many of its key business processes by bringing all its systems onto one platform. Responsible for implementation SABIC Europe from October 2014 till January 2016 as Change Manager EP and Functional Lead IP both responsible for Business Readiness and Change Management. As from February 2016 onwards as a Project Lead MM FANAR+ Europe at SABIC, leading the European procurement teams through the implementation of one global SAP system. Ensuring effective staffing of the various project areas, readiness of the organization and a smooth transition into the running business.

projects.title: SABIC Working Capital Optimization Global Project
projects.description:
The objective of the AP workstream within the WCO global project is to implement improvements in procurement and accounts payable processes, resulting in a sustainable increase in the ‘days taken’ to pay suppliers (thereby improving working capital).
This will be achieved by:
1. Internally: Improving SABIC Purchase to Pay (“P2P”)
2. Externally: Extending Payment Terms

projects.title: SABIC project P2P Global program
projects.description:
The Procurement to Pay program (P2P program) is a global program within SABIC. The procurement organization will be brought at world-class level by becoming a procurement organization with global harmonized processes and systems. (SAP-EUR, IP Oracle, SAP KSA) Next to system complexity and diversity there is multicultural complexity and diversity. 
2011 - 2012 First roll-out in Europe as Alignment Leader Europe.
2012 - 2013 further Global roll-outs (EUR-AMR-APAC) as a Business Alignment Manager.

projects.title: SABIC: Working Capital Optimization
projects.description:
Quick scan focusses on improvement area identification in MRO inventory value. 
1. Gain Insight in processes impacting MRO/ spare part inventory levels. 
2. Understand underlying drivers of current inventory value. 
3. Develop hypothesis to optimize inventory levels for identified WCO focus areas. Participated as project expert Geleen Site.

profile_positions.location: Geleen, Sittard, Bergen op Zoom, Raamdonksveer, Genk
profile_positions.description:
Sr. Manager of Procurement Department for Chemical Manufacturing Sites in the BENELUX.
• Secure Surety of Supply of all procured Directs Materials, Indirect Materials and Services, Projects and TA.
• Responsible for securing compliance to all legislation and SABIC standards, policies and procedures  
  including EHS and leading projects to reach compliance.
• Accountable for the execution of the Procure to Pay Process.
• Business partner for the Site Leadership. 
• Drive continuous improvement of procurement service in terms of value creation and customer 
  satisfaction. 
• Responsible for integration of these 4 sites w.r.t. Tactical and Operational Procurement.
• The department  exists of 40 employees, who are responsible for Procurement (Tactical and Operational), Masterdata Management and Warehouse Management.
profile_positions.title: Sr. Manager Procurement Benelux Sites

profile_positions.title: Manager procurement BENELUX Sites

profile_positions.description:
Manager of Procurement Department for Chemical Manufacturing Site in Bergen op Zoom, Netherlands.
• Secure Surety of Supply of all procured Directs Materials, Indirect materials and services and projects for Bergen op Zoom. 
• Responsible for securing compliance to all legislation and SABIC standards, policies and procedures including EHS and leading projects to reach compliance
• Accountable for the execution of the Procure to Pay Process (~40.000 orders/annual)
• Business partner for the site management 
• Drive continuous improvement of procurement service in terms of value creation and customer satisfaction. 
• Responsible for 21 FTE and 300-600MM$ ordered spend.
profile_positions.title: Manager procurement Site Bergen op Zoom and Raamsdonksveer

profile_positions.description:
Leading the European procurement teams through the implementation of one global SAP system. Ensuring effective staffing of the various project areas, readiness of the organization and a smooth transition into the running business. Managing a team of 10-15 fte depending on project phase.
Successfully implemented on 3 main locations throughout SABIC Europe EP including manufacturing sites and head office locations. Additional SABIC Europe IP locations in preparation phase for go-live in 2016.
profile_positions.title: Project lead MM FANAR+ Europe

profile_positions.description:
FANAR+ Global project is the largest IT Program that SABIC has ever run. It will standardise the company’s processes and enable SABIC to operate as one single global business in its markets, improving many of its key business processes by bringing all its systems onto one platform.
Functional Lead MM SABIC IP is responsible for all Procurement to Pay changes by developing and implementing strategies for business readiness. This to maximize acceptation for successful implementation of the proposed Global FANAR+ processes in order to maximize value creation and security of supply in an effective and efficient way. Scope is managing all necessary changes, responsible for all test activities, training requirements and quality aspects as identified within the FANAR+ Global program in the European Procurement organization and procurement business processes. Estimated timeline 1-2 years.

Responsible for successful realization, implementation and transfer of knowledge of the objectives as appointed by the PM. This includes (but is not limited to): 
•	European scattered stakeholder involvement. By managing expectations before, during and
        after implementation
•	Prepare business for the organization, process and system changes
•	Steer and support all Site Readiness Managers activities to ensure that all deliverables are
        met in time
•	Quality assurance and standardization of all products of and in the program
•	Responsible for all testing activities during ISRT and UAT
•	Steering the project test team in their day to day operations
•	Responsible for all training requirements like securing proper training material, assign and 
        educate qualified trainers and identify the correct users for training
•	Responsible for MM cutover plan
•	Support in Business Continuity Plan
•	Support Post Go-Live activities
profile_positions.title: Functional lead FANAR+ Global Project MM (SABIC EUROPE IP)

profile_positions.description:

profile_positions.title: Change manager FANAR+ Global Project MM (SABIC EUROPE EP)

profile_positions.description:
The Accounts Payable Lead is responsible for analysing procurement data, identifying procurement opportunities and validating with key stakeholders in SABIC Europe, due to the Working Capital Optimization global project.
The objective of the AP workstream is to implement improvements in procurement and accounts payable processes, resulting in a sustainable increase in the ‘days taken’ to pay suppliers (thereby improving working capital).
This will be achieved by:
1. Internally: Improving SABIC Purchase to Pay process (“P2P”)
2. Externally: Extending Payment Terms
profile_positions.title: Accounts Payable lead, SABIC WCO Working Capital Optimization Global Program

profile_positions.description: The P2P Business Alignment Manager is responsible for leading the global business readiness process for the strategic business change for Procurement to Pay, by developing and implementing strategies for business readiness. This is done in order to maximize acceptation for successful implementation of the proposed processes and systems and to maximize value creation and security of supply in an effective and efficient way. Scope is managing all necessary changes and quality aspects as identified within the P2P program in the global procurement organization and procurement business processes.
profile_positions.title: Business Alignment Manager, SABIC P2P Global Program

profile_positions.description: The P2P Program Alignment Leader (AL) is a key contributor for the value realization and the organizational changes resulting from the Procure to Pay (P2P) program. The AL realizes an integral part of the P2P program, designing “to be” processes, aligning the program deliverables in their regions, support realization of the business case, developing test scenario’s, testing during Proof-of-Concept (PoC), User Acceptance testing (UAT) and identifying and resolving all integration points between project work streams and Site Readiness Teams.  The AL will influence, coach and mentor Site and Global business teams during implementation to ensure effective transition.
profile_positions.title: Alignment leader Europe P2P Global project
